private_information: I hold disks from top to bottom: A, B, C, D
Disk A is the smallest, D is the largest
left_peg.goal: Help move all disks to the right peg in proper order with one disk moved at a time and never placing a larger disk on a smaller one.

middle_peg.goal: Help move all disks to the right peg in proper order with one disk moved at a time and never placing a larger disk on a smaller one.

right_peg.goal: Help move all disks to the right peg in proper order with one disk moved at a time and never placing a larger disk on a smaller one.

orchestrator.goal: Produce a single PDDL domain and PDDL problem file that encodes the Tower of Hanoi instance with 4 disks and three pegs for use with the FastDownwards planner to achieve the goal configuration.

public_information: There are three pegs named left, middle, and right.
There are 4 disks labeled A, B, C, D with A smallest and D largest.
Initially the left peg has disks top to bottom A, B, C, D and the other pegs are empty.
Goal: move the entire stack so the right peg has disks top to bottom A, B, C, D and other pegs are empty.
Rules: move only one disk at a time and never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.

describe.system_prompt: You represent the left peg in the Tower of Hanoi instance. Provide a precise local description of the disks currently on your peg, identify which disk is movable (the top one), and list any local constraints or observations relevant to moving disks. Do not produce PDDL. Be explicit about disk ordering and any assumptions you rely on.
describe.prompt: Your name is left_peg. Use the following public information: {environment->public_information} Use your private knowledge: {agents->left_peg->private_information} The global goal is: {agents->left_peg->goal} Provide a clear local description of your state, the legal moves you can perform, and constraints you observe.

describe.system_prompt: You represent the middle peg in the Tower of Hanoi instance. Provide a precise local description of the disks currently on your peg, identify which disk would be movable if present, and list any local constraints or observations relevant to receiving or moving disks. Do not produce PDDL.
describe.prompt: Your name is middle_peg. Use the following public information: {environment->public_information} Use your private knowledge: {agents->middle_peg->private_information} The global goal is: {agents->middle_peg->goal} Provide a clear local description of your state, the legal moves you can accept or perform, and constraints you observe.

describe.system_prompt: You represent the right peg in the Tower of Hanoi instance. Provide a precise local description of the disks currently on your peg, identify which disk would be movable if present, and list any local constraints or observations relevant to receiving or moving disks. Do not produce PDDL.
describe.prompt: Your name is right_peg. Use the following public information: {environment->public_information} Use your private knowledge: {agents->right_peg->private_information} The global goal is: {agents->right_peg->goal} Provide a clear local description of your state, the legal moves you can accept or perform, and constraints you observe.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. Integrate the local descriptions from each peg and produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file encoding the 4-disk Tower of Hanoi instance for the FastDownwards planner. The PDDL must model three pegs named left middle right, disks A B C D with size ordering A smaller than B smaller than C smaller than D, a move action that moves the top disk from one peg to another, the constraint that a larger disk cannot be placed on a smaller disk, and the initial and goal configurations. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Target FastDownwards compatibility with common-strips PDDL conventions.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Here are the local reports: {info_left} {info_middle} {info_right} The global objective is: {agents->orchestrator->goal} Integrate the reports and produce a PDDL domain and PDDL problem for FastDownwards that solves the instance. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> and the problem between <problem></problem>.
